intro: Silene phoenicodonta, commonly known as the scarlet sand-verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its showy, often pink or red flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in sandy or gravelly soils. Its flowers are usually arranged in clusters and bloom in late spring to early summer. The species is noted for its ecological importance, providing nectar for pollinators in its native habitat.
